item.title: Institutions
Nodes
item.description: Nodes, or Local Networks, provide a mechanism through which the aims of the SwissRN can be promoted within that institution (e.g., by establishing open research working groups, running training workshops, advocating for the wider adoption of best practice within the institution, etc.). Local Network Leads A Local Network Lead provides the point of contact for SwissRN, and represents a grass-roots network of researchers at that institution. It is intended that these Local Networks will grow, both in number and size, over time, as researchers elect to participate in SwissRN activities.

item.title: Organisation
item.description: Test Simon Test. Hugo is a static site engine written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: Cobra Viper J Walter Weatherman Cast Learn more and contribute on GitHub. Setup Some fun facts about Hugo: Built in Go Loosely inspired by Jekyll Primarily developed by spf13 on the train while commuting to and from Manhattan. Coded in Vim using spf13-vim Have questions or suggestions?

item.title: Stakeholders
item.description: Stakeholders who support the SwissRN form the Stakeholder Engagement Group. This ensures that SwissRN activity is aligned with the strategy and activity of the stakeholders, and allows the exchange of ideas. In addition, the relationship between the Stakeholder Engagement Group and the SwissRN provides stakeholders with a mechanism for obtaining feedback on new initiatives from the research community. See Annex 5: Potential Stakeholders in Switzerland. Stakeholder engagement groups More text …

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
